title: Synergistes jonesii
text: Synergistes jonesii is a species of bacteria, the type species of its genus. It is a <a href="rumen">rumen</a> bacterium that degrades toxic <a href="pyridinediol">pyridinediol</a>s including <a href="mimosine">mimosine</a>. It is obligately anaerobic, <a href="gram-negative">gram-negative</a> and rod-shaped. It was discovered in 1981 by <a href="Raymond%20J.%20Jones">Raymond J. Jones</a> in Hawaii and Jones' hypothesis was proven in 1986 by himself and <a href="R.%20G.%20Megarrity">R. G. Megarrity</a>.
